ACCESSION OF TAJIKISTAN TO THE AGREEMENT ON GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT
AGREEMENT ON GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT THIRD REVISED OFFER The following communication, dated
OFFER The following communication, dated 17 October
following communication, dated 17 October 2016, is being circulated at the request of the Delegation

Note to Annex 1 All agencies subordinate to the above listed central government entities are covered.
ANNEX 2 SUB-CENTRAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES

Note to Annex 2 The above sub-central authorities include their subordinate bodies and organizations which are under supervision or control of such authorities.
ANNEX 3 OTHER ENTITIES

above sub-central authorities include their subordinate bodies and organizations which are under supervision or control of such authorities.
ANNEX 3 OTHER ENTITIES Thresholds: Goods (4) SDR 400,000
Services1 SDR 400,000
Construction Services SDR 5,000,000 List of Entities: 1. All legal persons (authorities, establishments and foundations) governed by public law, particularly:
a. State non-commercial (non-profit) organizations; b. Commercial organizations with over 50
Commercial organizations with over 50% of government
government shareholding; c. Public services, including utilities sector companies. Notes to Annex 3 1
1. This list of entities shall be published in Procurement official electronic web-portal
list of entities shall be published in Procurement official electronic web-portal: [web address to be provided
2. Indicative lists of contracting authorities and public undertakings fulfilling the criteria set out above follow
INDICATIVE LISTS OF CONTRACTING AUTHORITIES AND PUBLIC UNDERTAKINGS FULFILLING THE CRITERIA LAID DOWN UNDER ANNEX 3
ANNEX 4 GOODS The Agreement applies to all goods procured by the entities listed in Annexes 1 to 3. Notes to Annex 4 1

services
ANNEX 6 CONSTRUCTION SERVICES List of Construction Services

ANNEX 6 CONSTRUCTION SERVICES List of Construction Services (Division 51, CPC Prov.): 1. The Agreement applies to all construction services procured by the entities listed in Annexes 1 to 3. 2. All construction services listed in Division 51 of the United Nations Provisional Central Product Classification (CPC Prov.) are covered

ANNEX 7 GENERAL NOTES The following General Notes apply without exception to this Agreement, including to Annexes 1 through 6.
1. This Agreement does not cover

following General Notes apply without exception to this Agreement, including to Annexes 1 through 6.
1. This Agreement does not cover: a. procurement
procurement of goods or services in respect of contracts for construction of chanceries abroad
procurement of goods or services by "Tajik Air" and Tajik Railways outside the territory of Tajikistan for consumption outside the territory of Tajikistan
outside the territory of Tajikistan for consumption outside the territory of Tajikistan; c. for greater certainty under Article II:3(b), commercial sponsorship arrangements
procurement by an entity covered under this Appendix from another entity covered under this Appendix, except where tenders are called, in which case, this Agreement shall apply

years transition period starting with the entry into force of the agreement for Republic of Tajikistan, procuring entities covered under Annex 1 to 3 may accord a price preference programme of up to 15% for the part of the tender incorporating goods and services originating from Republic of Tajikistan. The price preference and its application will be clearly described in the notice of intended procurement

1. APPENDIX II ELECTRONIC OR PAPER MEDIA UTILIZED BY PARTIES FOR THE PUBLICATION OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, JUDICIAL DECISIONS, ADMINISTRATIVE RULINGS OF GENERAL APPLICATION, STANDARD CONTRACT CLAUSES, AND PROCEDURES REGARDING GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT COVERED BY THIS AGREEMENT PURSUANT TO ARTICLE VI

APPENDIX II ELECTRONIC OR PAPER MEDIA UTILIZED BY PARTIES FOR THE PUBLICATION OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, JUDICIAL DECISIONS, ADMINISTRATIVE RULINGS OF GENERAL APPLICATION, STANDARD CONTRACT CLAUSES, AND PROCEDURES REGARDING GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT COVERED BY THIS AGREEMENT PURSUANT TO ARTICLE VI Tajikistan 1. Publication of general laws and regulations - [web address to be provided]. 2. Publication of GP measures - [web address to be provided]. 3. Publication of Judicial Decisions, Administrative Rulings of General Application - [web address to be provided]. 4. Publication of Standard Contract Clauses and Procedures regarding Government Procurement - [web address to be provided].
_______________ APPENDIX III ELECTRONIC OR PAPER MEDIA UTILIZED BY PARTIES FOR THE PUBLICATION OF NOTICES REQUIRED BY ARTICLES VII, IX:7 AND XVI:2 PURSUANT TO ARTICLE VI Tajikistan 1. Publication of Notices Required by Articles VII, IX:7 AND XVI:2 - [web address to be provided

1. Publication of Notices Required by Articles VII, IX:7 AND XVI:2 - [web address to be provided].
_______________ APPENDIX IV WEBSITE ADDRESS OR ADDRESSES WHERE PARTIES PUBLISH PROCUREMENT STATISTICS PURSUANT TO ARTICLE XVI:5 AND NOTICES CONCERNING AWARDED CONTRACTS PURSUANT TO ARTICLE XVI:6

APPENDIX IV WEBSITE ADDRESS OR ADDRESSES WHERE PARTIES PUBLISH PROCUREMENT STATISTICS PURSUANT TO ARTICLE XVI:5 AND NOTICES CONCERNING AWARDED CONTRACTS PURSUANT TO ARTICLE XVI:6 Tajikistan 1. Publication of procurement statistics - [web address to be provided]. 2. Publication of notices concerning awarded contracts - [web address to be provided
1) In English only. (2) Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject
Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject to a three-year transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR

transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR 150,000; in the second year following accession they will be SDR 140,000; from the beginning of the third year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 130,000
year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 130,000. (3) Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject
Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject to a three-year transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR

transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR 220,000; in the second year following accession they will be SDR 210,000; from the beginning of the third year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 200,000
year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 200,000. (4) Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject
Thresholds in respect of goods and services are subject to a three-year transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR

transition period. In the first year following accession, the thresholds for both goods and services will be SDR 500,000; in the second year following accession they will be SDR 450,000; from the beginning of the third year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 400,000

year following accession, the thresholds will be SDR 400,000. (5) Except contracts for financial services in connection with the issue, purchase, sale or transfer of securities or other financial instruments, and central bank services
